result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Antoine McKinney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leon Antoine McKinney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leon Antoine McKinney was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-Per signed Stipulation and Order by Judge Howard W. Cameron 9/29/14 - amend JOC to reflect ERP and CIP eligibility.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
Payable through Extended Supervision.
DNA Sample and surcharge.

-No Contact with L. Reed. Defendant may arrange for child visitation through third party and Agent approval.
-No Contact with anyone under the age of 18 without an approved chaperone/Agent approval.
-This does not include Defendant's minor child.
-Shall not engage in sexual behavior or relationship with any person without prior Agent approval.
-Shall not enter any dwelling whose primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Comply with Sex Offender Registry in state of residence.
-Comply with counseling, evaluation, assessment, including Domestic Abuse Assessment as recommended by Probation Agent.

-Complete AODA treatment.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

supervisions.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Alexis S. McKinley, DF ATTY:  Andrew M. Nelson, DF:  Leon Antione McKinney appeared from jail. Probation agent appears in court. Includes sentencing on 13CF369, 13CM486, 13CM600 and 14CF25. PSI is discussed and corrections noted.  Sentencing recommendations. Court orders: Total confinement of 6 yrs, 0 mths. Initial confinement 3 yrs, 0 months with credit for 107 days. Extended supervision 3 years, 0 months with conditions: 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with L. Reed. Def may arrange for child visititation through a third party and agent approval. 
- No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without an approved chaperone/agent approval. This does NOT include defendant's minor child.
- Shall not engage in sexual behavior or relationship with another person without prior agent approval. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Shall not to enter any dwelling whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
- Complete AODA treatment.
- Comply with sex offender registry in state of residence. 
- Comply with any counseling, evaluation, assessment, including domestic abuse assessment, as recommended by probation agent.
- $268.00 in court costs. 

13CF369: $243 in court costs. 6 months jail, concurrent.
13CM486: $243.00 in court costs for each count - total of $486.00.  Count 1: 90 days jail, concurrent. Count 2: 9 months jail, concurrent
13CM600: $243.00 in court costs. 9 months jail,  concurrent

Defendant is advised of right to appeal.

records.addlTxt: Signed by EJL on 2/21/14. sf

*AMENDED* Includes 13CF369, 13CM486, 13CM600 and 14CF25. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Lehanne R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Matthew Hartung, DF ATTY:  Andrew Nelson,  DF:  Leon Antione McKinney appeared from jail. Includes 14CF25, 14CF55, 13CM486, 13CM487, 13CM600, 13CM615, 13CF369 & 13CF372, 13TR5338. Court reviews feloney conviction and constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for: 13CF369 - ct 3 (Possess of THC), 13CM486 - ct 1 (Disorderly) and ct 2 (Resisting), 13CM600 - ct 2 (Bail Jumping) and 14CF25 - ct 1 (Bail Jumping). 
Def pleads Guilty to ct 1 in 14CF25, ct 2 in 13CM600, ct 3 in 13CF369, cts 1 and 2 in 13CM486.
Court uses complaints/reports/testimony as factual basis; accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty in:
13CF369 - ct 3 (Possess of THC), 13CM486 - ct 1 (Disorderly) and ct 2 (Resisting), 13CM600 - ct 2 (Bailjumping) and 14CF25 - ct 1 (Bailjumping). 
Court dismisses 14CF25 - ct 2; 13CM600 - cts 1, 3 and 4; 13CF369 - cts 2 and 4. 
Court dismisses 13CF372, 13CM487, 13CM615 & 13TR5338 and 14CF55. 
The State requests a PSI. Court orders a PSI - long form. Atty Nelson moves to consolidate bonds. Bond to include 13CF369, 13CM486, 13CM600 and 14CF25.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Michael E Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Andrew Nelson, DF:  Leon Antione McKinney appeared from jail. Set for a preliminary hearing. It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  St. Croix County unless here with court.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
